articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces retreated from some Gaza City districts overnight after a fierce, week-long military offensive, leaving dozens of dead and wrecked homes and roads in the Palestinian enclave's biggest urban area, residents and rescue service said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli forces pull back after Gaza City offensive, leaving dozens of bodies, rescue service says

articles.author: Ahmed Mohamed Hassan, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli and Egyptian ceasefire negotiators are in talks about an electronic surveillance system along the border between Gaza and Egypt that could allow Israel to pull back its troops from the area if a ceasefire is agreed, according to two Egyptian sources and a third source familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: Gaza talks explore alternative to Israeli troops on Gaza-Egypt border

articles.author: Arathy Somasekhar
articles.description: About a million homes and businesses in Texas remained without power on Friday, five days after Hurricane Beryl made landfall, with fierce winds and rain that knocked down trees and electricity infrastructure.
articles.title: Nearly a million in Texas still without power after Hurricane Beryl

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Joe Biden has shown he is "a pro-Russian candidate being controlled by the Kremlin," Russia's Foreign Ministry spokeswoman joked on Friday, after the U.S. president misspoke and introduced Ukraine's leader as "President Putin" before correcting himself.
articles.title: In Russia, Biden's verbal slip over Putin's name draws mockery and unease

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: NATO leaders will end their summit on Thursday with a clear focus on backing Ukraine and countering what the allies say is the growing threat Russia poses to Europe, as U.S. President Joe Biden faces growing calls from members of his Democratic party to drop his re-election bid.
articles.title: NATO to back Ukraine as Biden faces growing pressure to drop out of presidential race

articles.author: Manoj Kumar
articles.description: India's main opposition Congress party asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday to impose an additional tax on the country's billionaires to generate funds for stretched public services like education and health.
articles.title: India's opposition Congress asks Modi to tax billionaires more

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan spoke to his Indian counterpart Ajit Doval on Friday, India said, just days after the U.S. raised concerns with New Delhi about Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin.
articles.title: Sullivan talks to Indian counterpart days after Indian PM Modi's Russia visit

articles.author: Marcela Ayres, Bernardo Caram
articles.description: More than 100 countries are expected to back a global alliance against hunger that Brazil has proposed to counter the increasing number of people going hungry in the world, a Brazilian minister said.
articles.title: Brazil sees over 100 countries joining alliance against hunger, minister says

articles.author: Joshua Inusa
articles.description: At least seven lifeless bodies have been pulled from the rubble of a collapsed school building in central Nigeria's Plateau state on Friday, a Reuters witness said.
articles.title: At least seven bodies pulled from collapsed school in central Nigeria

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: After a shock defeat in France's legislative elections, Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN) will double down on weeding out problematic candidates to counter successful efforts by mainstream parties to block the far right from power.
articles.title: France election: Le Pen's National Rally to professionalize after defeat
